record.title: ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, APRIL 1, 2008
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, APRIL 1, 2008 -- (Senate - March 31, 2008)

[Page: S2251]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand in recess until 10 a.m. tomorrow, April 1; that following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day, and the Senate proceed to a period of morning business until 12:30 p.m., with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each, with the time equally divided and controlled between the two leaders or their designees; further, I ask that at 12:30 p.m., the Senate recess until 2:15 p.m. to allow for the weekly caucus luncheons.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
